metadata.name: AHC Premium Intense Contour Balm 1 g 100mL Solution

clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Indicated to prevent recurrence of malignant pleural effusions in symptomatic patients during thoracoscopy or open thoracotomy

incompatibilities.description: The serum concentration of Talc can be increased when it is combined with Calcitriol
The serum concentration of Talc can be increased when it is combined with Calcifediol
The serum concentration of Talc can be increased when it is combined with Ergocalciferol
The serum concentration of Talc can be increased when it is combined with Cholecalciferol
The serum concentration of Talc can be increased when it is combined with Paricalcitol
The serum concentration of Talc can be increased when it is combined with Dihydrotachysterol
The serum concentration of Talc can be increased when it is combined with Alfacalcidol
The serum concentration of Talc can be increased when it is combined with Seocalcitol
The serum concentration of Talc can be increased when it is combined with Inecalcitol
The serum concentration of Talc can be increased when it is combined with Becocalcidiol
The serum concentration of Talc can be increased when it is combined with Eldecalcitol
The serum concentration of Talc can be increased when it is combined with 1alpha 24S Dihydroxyvitamin D2
The serum concentration of Talc can be increased when it is combined with Elocalcitol
The serum concentration of Talc can be increased when it is combined with Maxacalcitol
The serum concentration of Talc can be increased when it is combined with Doxercalciferol
The serum concentration of Talc can be increased when it is combined with Vitamin D
The serum concentration of Talc can be increased when it is combined with 1alpha Hydroxyvitamin D5
Talc can cause a decrease in the absorption of Deferiprone resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy
Talc can cause a decrease in the absorption of Eltrombopag resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy

Talc can cause a decrease in the absorption of Grepafloxacin resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy
Talc can cause a decrease in the absorption of Enoxacin resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy
Talc can cause a decrease in the absorption of Pefloxacin resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy
Talc can cause a decrease in the absorption of Ciprofloxacin resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy
Talc can cause a decrease in the absorption of Trovafloxacin resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy
Talc can cause a decrease in the absorption of Nalidixic acid resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy
Talc can cause a decrease in the absorption of Rosoxacin resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy
Talc can cause a decrease in the absorption of Cinoxacin resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy
Talc can cause a decrease in the absorption of Lomefloxacin resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy
Talc can cause a decrease in the absorption of Gatifloxacin resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy

Talc can cause a decrease in the absorption of Fleroxacin resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy

Talc can cause a decrease in the absorption of Nemonoxacin resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy
Talc can cause a decrease in the absorption of Flumequine resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy
Talc can cause a decrease in the absorption of Enrofloxacin resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy
Talc can cause a decrease in the absorption of Orbifloxacin resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy

Talc can cause a decrease in the absorption of Rufloxacin resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy
Talc can cause a decrease in the absorption of Pipemidic acid resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy
The absorption of Doxycycline can be decreased when combined with Talc
The absorption of Gemifloxacin can be decreased when combined with Talc
